Japanese:
//Text $1B2C80
#WRITE(ptr,$18DD30)
火属性の知能ある剣。[LINE]
人格は、熱血漢の切り込み隊長。[LINE]
ディムロス・ティンバー。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2C80
#WRITE(ptr,$18DD30)
Swordian of Fire. Leader of an[LINE]
army. His full name is Dymlos[LINE]
Timber.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2C20
#WRITE(ptr,$18DD6C)
水属性の知能ある剣。[LINE]
人格は、激情を秘めた理知的な女性。[LINE]
アトワイト・エックス。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2C20
#WRITE(ptr,$18DD6C)
Swordian of Water. A fierce and[LINE]
intelligent woman. Her full name[LINE]
name is Atwight Ecks.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2BC0
#WRITE(ptr,$18DDA8)
光属性の知能ある剣。[LINE]
人格は、知識と経験のある老人。[LINE]
ラヴィル・クレメンテ。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2BC0
#WRITE(ptr,$18DDA8)
Swordian of Light. A wise old[LINE]
man. His full name is Laville[LINE]
Clemente.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2B50
#WRITE(ptr,$18DDE4)
風属性の知能ある剣。[LINE]
人格は、知性と合理性を持った男性。[LINE]
イクティノス・マイナード。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2B50
#WRITE(ptr,$18DDE4)
Swordian of Wind. A rational[LINE]
and intelligent man. His full [LINE]
name is Igtenos Mindarde.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2AE0
#WRITE(ptr,$18DE20)
地属性の知能ある剣。[LINE]
人格は、才能に恵まれた若き青年。[LINE]
ピエール・ド・シャルティエ。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2AE0
#WRITE(ptr,$18DE20)
Swordian of Earth.[LINE]
A gifted young man, his full name is[LINE]
Pierre de Chaltier.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2A80
#WRITE(ptr,$18DE5C)
各国の軍隊に採用されている剣。[LINE]
シンプルな作りで非常に扱いやすい。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B2A80
#WRITE(ptr,$18DE5C)
A sword adopted by the armed[LINE]
forces of many countries.[LINE]
Easy to use.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2A18
#WRITE(ptr,$18DE98)
ファンダリア王家に伝わる名剣。[LINE]
見た目の豪華さとは裏腹に、[LINE]
鋭い切れ味を持つ。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2A18
#WRITE(ptr,$18DE98)
A famous sword handed down from[LINE]
the Royal Family of Phandaria.[LINE]
Looks sharp.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B29A0
#WRITE(ptr,$18DED4)
飛行竜の船倉に厳重保管されていた、[LINE]
変わった形の妙に手になじむ剣。[LINE]
何か得体の知れない力を感じる……[END]
English:
//Text $1B29A0
#WRITE(ptr,$18DED4)
An oddly shaped sword and comfy in the hand.[LINE]
It was kept on the Draconis.[LINE]
A powerful aura can be felt[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2940
#WRITE(ptr,$18DF10)
石を削って作られた石製の斧。[LINE]
すでに時代遅れの武器だが[LINE]
人の進化の証。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2940
#WRITE(ptr,$18DF10)
A knapped stone axe.[LINE]
Although obsolete, it's[LINE]
still a human milestone.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B28E0
#WRITE(ptr,$18DF4C)
耐食性の優れた銅製の斧。[LINE]
天地戦争時代から使われていた[LINE]
優秀な金属。[END]
English:
//Text $1B28E0
#WRITE(ptr,$18DF4C)
An axe made of copper with excellent[LINE]
erosion resistance. Metal that has been[LINE]
used since the age of the Aeth'er War.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2888
#WRITE(ptr,$18DF88)
さまざまな構造物に使われる[LINE]
鉄製の斧。[LINE]
もっとも身近な金属。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2888
#WRITE(ptr,$18DF88)
An axe made of iron. Metal that is[LINE]
used in a variety of structures.[LINE]
The most common metal.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2840
#WRITE(ptr,$18DFC4)
鉄に炭素を混ぜてできる合金。[LINE]
鋼製の斧。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B2840
#WRITE(ptr,$18DFC4)
An axe made of steel. Steel is[LINE]
an alloy formed by mixing iron[LINE]
with carbon.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B27D8
#WRITE(ptr,$18E000)
さまざまな用途に使われる[LINE]
チタン製の斧。[LINE]
非常に軽く、並外れた耐食性を持つ。[END]
English:
//Text $1B27D8
#WRITE(ptr,$18E000)
This axe is used for a variety[LINE]
of tasks. It is very light, with[LINE]
incredible corrosion resistance.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2790
#WRITE(ptr,$18E03C)
銀細工で装飾された斧。[LINE]
白い輝きが美しい。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B2790
#WRITE(ptr,$18E03C)
An axe adorned with silverwork.[LINE]
It has a beautiful white shine.[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2740
#WRITE(ptr,$18E078)
金をふんだんに混ぜて作られた斧。[LINE]
別名「豪華な斧」。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B2740
#WRITE(ptr,$18E078)
An axe made by using a rich[LINE]
mixture of gold. Known as the[LINE]
"Luxurious Axe".[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B26E0
#WRITE(ptr,$18E0B4)
ミスリルを用いて鍛え上げた斧。[LINE]
ドワーフ族の芸術作品といわれる。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B26E0
#WRITE(ptr,$18E0B4)
An axe forged out of mithril.[LINE]
It is said to be a product of[LINE]
the Dwarves.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2680
#WRITE(ptr,$18E0F0)
非常に扱いやすい小型の斧。[LINE]
少し力があれば片手でも軽々[LINE]
扱うことが可能。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2680
#WRITE(ptr,$18E0F0)
A small, very easy-to-use small[LINE]
axe. You don't need to be very[LINE]
strong to wield it in one hand.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2628
#WRITE(ptr,$18E12C)
切れ味鋭い肉厚の斧。[LINE]
その名の通り、[LINE]
戦闘用に特化されている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2628
#WRITE(ptr,$18E12C)
A thick-tapered axe with a sharp[LINE]
edge. As its name suggests, it is[LINE]
optimized for battle.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B25B0
#WRITE(ptr,$18E168)
この斧を初めて見たキコリが、[LINE]
「グレートだ！」と叫んだことから[LINE]
この名がついた。切れ味も抜群。[END]
English:
//Text $1B25B0
#WRITE(ptr,$18E168)
A famous lumberjack once praised this[LINE]
axe with the words: "Wow! It's great!",[LINE]
which was how it received its name.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2548
#WRITE(ptr,$18E1A4)
三日月の形を模した斧。[LINE]
乳白色の刃は闇で振るうと[LINE]
より月のように見えるらしい。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2548
#WRITE(ptr,$18E1A4)
An axe shaped like a crescent moon.[LINE]
This milky-white blade more resembles[LINE]
a moon when wielded in the dark.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B24D8
#WRITE(ptr,$18E1E0)
刃の反対側に尻尾のように伸びた[LINE]
切っ先が特徴の斧。[LINE]
地面に突き刺すために使われる。[END]
English:
//Text $1B24D8
#WRITE(ptr,$18E1E0)
An axe with an edge that extends to[LINE]
the other side of the blade. Used for[LINE]
thrusting into the ground.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2480
#WRITE(ptr,$18E21C)
対剣士用に作られた斧。[LINE]
刃の隙間は剣を引っ掛け[LINE]
折るためのもの。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2480
#WRITE(ptr,$18E21C)
An axe designed to fight swordsmen.[LINE]
Hook and break swords by using the[LINE]
gap in its edge.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2410
#WRITE(ptr,$18E258)
特徴的な薄く丸い刃を持つ斧。[LINE]
力のない者が振るっても[LINE]
容易く肉を裂けられるほど鋭い。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2410
#WRITE(ptr,$18E258)
An axe characterized by its thin,[LINE]
round edge. Easily cuts through[LINE]
flesh, even with little strength.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B23A0
#WRITE(ptr,$18E294)
名工ギースの魂がこもった[LINE]
無二の傑作。きわめて希少価値が[LINE]
高く、戦士たちの憧れの斧。[END]
English:
//Text $1B23A0
#WRITE(ptr,$18E294)
A masterpiece filled with the soul[LINE]
of master craftsman Giese. It's [LINE]
valuable. A warrior's dream axe.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2338
#WRITE(ptr,$18E2D0)
「切るための道具」[LINE]
という意味の名を持つ斧。[LINE]
扱いが上手ければ投げることも可能。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2338
#WRITE(ptr,$18E2D0)
An axe whose name means "A tool[LINE]
for cutting."If you're skillful, you can[LINE]
throw it.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B22E0
#WRITE(ptr,$18E30C)
非常に重く、鋭い切っ先を持つ斧。[LINE]
重装備の鎧でさえ打ち砕ける。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B22E0
#WRITE(ptr,$18E30C)
A heavy axe with a sharp cutting[LINE]
edge. Shatters even the heaviest[LINE]
of armors.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2278
#WRITE(ptr,$18E348)
先端が槍状になっている斧。[LINE]
斬るだけでなく[LINE]
刺すこともできる優秀な斧。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2278
#WRITE(ptr,$18E348)
An axe with a spear-shaped tip.[LINE]
Not only can it cut, but it can[LINE]
also stab.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2220
#WRITE(ptr,$18E384)
斧刃と鈎爪を併せ持つ斧。[LINE]
馬上の敵を引きずり下ろすのに有効。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B2220
#WRITE(ptr,$18E384)
An axe with an edge and a[LINE]
hooked claw. Used to drag[LINE]
down foes on horseback.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B21C8
#WRITE(ptr,$18E3C0)
斧頭が目の形をしていることから[LINE]
この名がつけられた大型の斧。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B21C8
#WRITE(ptr,$18E3C0)
An axe whose name is taken[LINE]
from its eye-shaped axe head.[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2160
#WRITE(ptr,$18E3FC)
アイアックスを[LINE]
より扱いやすくした斧。[LINE]
攻撃力もアップし軽量化も図られた。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2160
#WRITE(ptr,$18E3FC)
An improved Eye Axe that is easier[LINE]
to handle. The attack power has[LINE]
increased and it weighs less.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2100
#WRITE(ptr,$18E438)
大地の名で呼ばれる斧。[LINE]
華奢な形状からは想像できない[LINE]
威力を持つ。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2100
#WRITE(ptr,$18E438)
An axe named after the Earth itself.[LINE]
Its slender shape belies its power.[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2098
#WRITE(ptr,$18E474)
伝説に登場する幻想の力を秘めた斧。[LINE]
口伝を書物にまとめた兄弟の名を[LINE]
冠する。[END]
English:
//Text $1B2098
#WRITE(ptr,$18E474)
An axe with legendary powers that appears[LINE]
in folklore. It bears the name of the brothers[LINE]
who recorded oral traditions.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B2048
#WRITE(ptr,$18E4B0)
三日月型の斧頭が特徴の戦斧。[LINE]
少ない金属で作ることが可能な斧。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B2048
#WRITE(ptr,$18E4B0)
An axe with a crescent-shaped head.[LINE]
It can be made with a small amount[LINE]
of metal.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1FF0
#WRITE(ptr,$18E4EC)
金属で強化することで[LINE]
強度を上げた斧。[LINE]
日常の道具としても使用可能。[END]
English:
//Text $1B1FF0
#WRITE(ptr,$18E4EC)
An axe reinforced with metal[LINE]
for extra strength. Can be[LINE]
used as an everyday tool.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1F98
#WRITE(ptr,$18E528)
斧頭がノミのようになっている斧。[LINE]
見た目の優美さと異なり、[LINE]
刃先は鋭い。[END]
English:
//Text $1B1F98
#WRITE(ptr,$18E528)
An axe with a chisel-shaped head.[LINE]
Contrary to its graceful appearance,[LINE]
it's actually quite sharp.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1F40
#WRITE(ptr,$18E564)
タフレンズが埋め込まれた[LINE]
半月型の斧。豪華な作りだが[LINE]
切れ味は鋭い。[END]
English:
//Text $1B1F40
#WRITE(ptr,$18E564)
A half-moon shaped axe with[LINE]
a tough lens embedded. It's[LINE]
luxurious, but sharp.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1EE0
#WRITE(ptr,$18E5A0)
植物のような装飾をされた戦斧。[LINE]
装飾のわりに軽量なため、[LINE]
殴打武器としても優秀。[END]
English:
//Text $1B1EE0
#WRITE(ptr,$18E5A0)
A battle axe decorated to look[LINE]
like a plant. It's light, but is an[LINE]
excellent tool for  bludgeoning.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1E78
#WRITE(ptr,$18E5DC)
刃が上向きになっている斧。[LINE]
透明感のある美しい刃は、[LINE]
祭事用に使われていた時の名残。[END]
English:
//Text $1B1E78
#WRITE(ptr,$18E5DC)
An axe with an upturned blade.[LINE]
Its beautiful, clear blade is a[LINE]
remnant from its use in rituals.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1E20
#WRITE(ptr,$18E618)
三日月型の幅広い斧頭を持つ戦斧。[LINE]
敵を切断するのに特化している。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B1E20
#WRITE(ptr,$18E618)
A battle axe with a broad, crescent[LINE]
shaped head. Specializes in cutting[LINE]
down foes.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1DB8
#WRITE(ptr,$18E654)
空想を意味する斧。[LINE]
手にした者の想いを力に変える。[LINE]
選ばれた者のみが手にできる。[END]
English:
//Text $1B1DB8
#WRITE(ptr,$18E654)
An axe that signifies a fantasy. It[LINE]
transforms the user's thoughts into[LINE]
power. Only the chosen may wield it.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1D60
#WRITE(ptr,$18E690)
食物繊維が豊富なさつまいも。[LINE]
低温でじっくり加熱すると[LINE]
甘みが増す。[END]
English:
//Text $1B1D60
#WRITE(ptr,$18E690)
Sweet potatoes are rich in fiber.[LINE]
Cook it at low temperatures to[LINE]
increase its sweetness.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1D10
#WRITE(ptr,$18E6CC)
木製の小型弓。[LINE]
初心者用の弓として広く扱われる。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B1D10
#WRITE(ptr,$18E6CC)
A small wooden bow.[LINE]
A beginner's best friend.[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1CC8
#WRITE(ptr,$18E708)
鉄に炭素を混ぜてできる合金、[LINE]
鋼製の小型弓。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B1CC8
#WRITE(ptr,$18E708)
A small bow made of steel.[LINE]
[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1C80
#WRITE(ptr,$18E744)
さまざまな用途に使われる、[LINE]
チタン製の小型弓。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B1C80
#WRITE(ptr,$18E744)
A small bow made of titanium.[LINE]
It is very versatile.[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1C38
#WRITE(ptr,$18E780)
銀細工で装飾された小型弓。[LINE]
白い輝きが美しい。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B1C38
#WRITE(ptr,$18E780)
A small bow decorated with[LINE]
silver. It shines beautifully. [LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1BE8
#WRITE(ptr,$18E7BC)
８割が金で作られた小型弓。[LINE]
別名「豪華な小型弓」。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B1BE8
#WRITE(ptr,$18E7BC)
A small bow made of 80 percent gold.[LINE]
Also known as "The Beautiful Bow."[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1B88
#WRITE(ptr,$18E7F8)
ミスリルを用いて鍛え上げた小型弓。[LINE]
ドワーフ族の芸術作品といわれる。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B1B88
#WRITE(ptr,$18E7F8)
Weaved out of the finest mithril,[LINE]
this small bow is a work of art[LINE]
created by dwarven craftsmen.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1B38
#WRITE(ptr,$18E834)
猟師が好んで使う弓の小型版。[LINE]
安価な割りに性能は高い。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B1B38
#WRITE(ptr,$18E834)
A smaller version of a hunter's bow.[LINE]
Good performance at an affordable[LINE]
price![END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1AD0
#WRITE(ptr,$18E870)
その名の通り戦闘に特化した小型弓。[LINE]
強度があり、敵の攻撃を受けても[LINE]
歪みにくい。[END]
English:
//Text $1B1AD0
#WRITE(ptr,$18E870)
A combat oriented bow.[LINE]
Holds together even when[LINE]
struck by enemy attacks.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1A90
#WRITE(ptr,$18E8AC)
一撃必中。[LINE]
暗殺に特化された小型弓。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B1A90
#WRITE(ptr,$18E8AC)
It only takes one shot. A small[LINE]
bow made for assassins.[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1A28
#WRITE(ptr,$18E8E8)
鷹の爪を模した弧を描いた小型弓。[LINE]
天高く飛ぶ鳥も射ぬけると[LINE]
言われている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B1A28
#WRITE(ptr,$18E8E8)
A small bow with an arch that resembles[LINE]
a griffin's claw. It is said to be able to[LINE]
shoot birds flying high in the sky.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B19C0
#WRITE(ptr,$18E924)
名工ギースの魂がこもった[LINE]
無二の傑作。きわめて希少価値が[LINE]
高く、戦士たちの憧れの小型弓。[END]
English:
//Text $1B19C0
#WRITE(ptr,$18E924)
An unparalleled masterpiece that contains[LINE]
the soul of Giese, a master craftsman.[LINE]
An irreplaceable treasure to any archer.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1970
#WRITE(ptr,$18E960)
全てのパーツを異なった木材で[LINE]
組み合わせた小型弓。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B1970
#WRITE(ptr,$18E960)
A small meshwork bow made [LINE]
from a variety of woods.[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1918
#WRITE(ptr,$18E99C)
エルフ族が愛用したと言われている[LINE]
小型弓。羽のように軽い。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B1918
#WRITE(ptr,$18E99C)
A small bow said to be used by[LINE]
elves. It is as light as a feather.[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B18A8
#WRITE(ptr,$18E9D8)
三日月の形を模した小型弓。[LINE]
その美しさに獣たちも動きを止める。[LINE]
と、言われている。[END]
English:
//Text $1B18A8
#WRITE(ptr,$18E9D8)
A small bow in the shape of a crescent[LINE]
moon. It is said that even the mightiest[LINE]
beasts are paralyzed by its beauty.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1838
#WRITE(ptr,$18EA14)
無敵を誇った弓兵が使用していた、[LINE]
と言われる弓の小型版。[LINE]
別名「狂戦士の弓」小型版。[END]
English:
//Text $1B1838
#WRITE(ptr,$18EA14)
A smaller version of "The Madman's Bow."[LINE]
The originals were owned by archers who[LINE]
claimied to be invincible.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B17D0
#WRITE(ptr,$18EA50)
伝説に登場する幻想の力を秘めた[LINE]
小型弓。口伝を書物にまとめた[LINE]
兄弟の名を冠する。[END]
English:
//Text $1B17D0
#WRITE(ptr,$18EA50)
An small bow named after two Brothers.[LINE]
Its power of illusion may make you feel[LINE]
like you are the huntsman himself.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1750
#WRITE(ptr,$18EA8C)
情熱的で美しい女戦士が愛用して[LINE]
いた弓の小型版。針の穴をも通す[LINE]
ことから、この名がつけられた。[END]
English:
//Text $1B1750
#WRITE(ptr,$18EA8C)
A smaller bow used by passionate and[LINE]
beautiful female warriors. Its precision[LINE]
could thread a needle.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1700
#WRITE(ptr,$18EAC8)
必殺必中。稲妻のような速さで[LINE]
狙った獲物を貫く小型弓。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B1700
#WRITE(ptr,$18EAC8)
What a deadly shot! This small bow [LINE]
fires arrows at lightning speed![LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B16A0
#WRITE(ptr,$18EB04)
この弓で射抜いた者の魂を吸い上げ[LINE]
所有者の力にすると言われている。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B16A0
#WRITE(ptr,$18EB04)
A diabolical weapon that turns[LINE]
the souls of those it slays into[LINE]
power for its wielder.[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1630
#WRITE(ptr,$18EB40)
遥か昔に落ちた隕石から作られた[LINE]
小型弓。その素材の成分は[LINE]
解明されていない。[END]
English:
//Text $1B1630
#WRITE(ptr,$18EB40)
A small bow made from an ancient[LINE]
meteorite. Its unique craftsmanship[LINE]
baffles tradesmen to this day.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B15B8
#WRITE(ptr,$18EB7C)
運命を意味する小型弓。[LINE]
手にした者の望む運命を呼び寄せる。[LINE]
選ばれた者のみが手にできる。[END]
English:
//Text $1B15B8
#WRITE(ptr,$18EB7C)
A small bow that symbolizes destiny. Those[LINE]
who use it can bend fate to their will. Only[LINE]
those who are worthy may wield it.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1558
#WRITE(ptr,$18EBB8)
いぼがチクチクするものほど新鮮な証。[LINE]
未熟なうちに収穫するのがポイント。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B1558
#WRITE(ptr,$18EBB8)
The more prickly the warts, the more[LINE]
fresh they are. The key is to harvest[LINE]
them while they are still immature.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1510
#WRITE(ptr,$18EBF4)
さまざまな構造物に使われる[LINE]
鉄製のナックル。[LINE]
[END]

//Text $1B14C8
#WRITE(ptr,$18EC30)
さまざまな用途に使われる[LINE]
チタン製のナックル。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B14C8
#WRITE(ptr,$18EC30)
Knuckles made of titanium.[LINE]
They are very versatile.[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1478
#WRITE(ptr,$18EC6C)
銀細工で装飾されたナックル。[LINE]
白い輝きが美しい。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B1478
#WRITE(ptr,$18EC6C)
Knuckles decorated with silver.[LINE]
Reminiscent of a pure white glove.[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1428
#WRITE(ptr,$18ECA8)
金をふんだんに混ぜて作られた。[LINE]
別名「豪華な拳」。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B1428
#WRITE(ptr,$18ECA8)
Knuckles made with a large portion of gold.[LINE]
They are also known as "The Fabulous Fists."[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B13D0
#WRITE(ptr,$18ECE4)
ミスリルを用いて鍛え上げた。[LINE]
ドワーフ族の芸術作品といわれる。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B13D0
#WRITE(ptr,$18ECE4)
Weaved out of the finest mithril,[LINE]
these knuckles are works of art[LINE]
created by dwarven craftsmen.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1378
#WRITE(ptr,$18ED20)
拳の部分を厚く強化したナックル。[LINE]
素の拳より３割増で強くなる。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B1378
#WRITE(ptr,$18ED20)
These reinforced knuckles are 30%[LINE]
more durable than your bare fists![LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1308
#WRITE(ptr,$18ED5C)
殴るより刺すことに重点を置いた[LINE]
ナックル。針の分リーチが長いので[LINE]
大振りな人にお勧め。[END]
English:
//Text $1B1308
#WRITE(ptr,$18ED5C)
Knuckles focused on stabbing rather than[LINE]
punching. The length of the needles makes[LINE]
it better for people with large swings.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B12A0
#WRITE(ptr,$18ED98)
ダイヤを磨き刃にした美しい[LINE]
ナックル。鋭くて硬いため、[LINE]
とてつもなく痛い。[END]
English:
//Text $1B12A0
#WRITE(ptr,$18ED98)
Beautiful knuckles with diamond polished[LINE]
blades. Sharp, hard, and hurts like hell![LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1228
#WRITE(ptr,$18EDD4)
名工ギースの魂がこもった[LINE]
無二の傑作。きわめて希少価値が[LINE]
高く、戦士たちの憧れのナックル。[END]
English:
//Text $1B1228
#WRITE(ptr,$18EDD4)
An unparalleled masterpiece that contains[LINE]
the soul of Giese, a master craftsman.[LINE]
An irreplaceable treasure to any warrior.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B11C8
#WRITE(ptr,$18EE10)
熊の手を模したナックル。[LINE]
使用されている獣毛は本物で、[LINE]
ちょっと臭い。[END]
English:
//Text $1B11C8
#WRITE(ptr,$18EE10)
Ready to fight bear handed?[LINE]
The fur is from an actual bear![LINE]
It's a bit smelly...[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1150
#WRITE(ptr,$18EE4C)
アクアヴェイルの伝説に登場する、[LINE]
ドラゴンをイメージしたナックル。[LINE]
鉤爪があり、引掻くのも有効。[END]
English:
//Text $1B1150
#WRITE(ptr,$18EE4C)
Knuckles made in the image of a dragon[LINE]
from Aquaveil legends. It will bite into[LINE]
and tear apart your opponents.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B10F0
#WRITE(ptr,$18EE88)
初代チャンピオンが愛用していたと[LINE]
言われている由緒あるナックル。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B10F0
#WRITE(ptr,$18EE88)
Venerable knuckles that were said to[LINE]
have been used by the first champion.[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1080
#WRITE(ptr,$18EEC4)
伝説に登場する幻想の力を秘めた[LINE]
ナックル。口伝を書物にまとめた[LINE]
兄弟の名を冠する。[END]
English:
//Text $1B1080
#WRITE(ptr,$18EEC4)
Knuckles with the power of illusions.[LINE]
It bears the name of two brothers[LINE]
who transcribed many legends.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B1018
#WRITE(ptr,$18EF00)
悪意を意味するナックル。[LINE]
角で切り裂き、毒を注いで敵の[LINE]
動きを麻痺させる凶悪な武器。[END]
English:
//Text $1B1018
#WRITE(ptr,$18EF00)
Knuckles of pure malice. This weapon[LINE]
tears flesh with its horns, then pours in[LINE]
a paralyzing poison.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B0FA8
#WRITE(ptr,$18EF3C)
どこで殴っても敵に致命傷を[LINE]
与える恐ろしいナックル。[LINE]
「威力組織」の意味を有する。[END]
English:
//Text $1B0FA8
#WRITE(ptr,$18EF3C)
Terrifying knuckles that will deal a lethal[LINE]
blow no matter where they hit. It's name[LINE]
means "A Powerful Organization."[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B0F50
#WRITE(ptr,$18EF78)
神の兵器と名付けられたナックル。[LINE]
輝く拳は全ての悪を打ち砕く。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B0F50
#WRITE(ptr,$18EF78)
Knuckles that are akin to God's wrath.[LINE]
These shining fists crush all evil.[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B0EE0
#WRITE(ptr,$18EFB4)
世界を意味するナックル。[LINE]
望めば世界を牛耳る力を得る。[LINE]
選ばれた者のみが手にできる。[END]
English:
//Text $1B0EE0
#WRITE(ptr,$18EFB4)
These knuckles represent the world. With[LINE]
their power, you could conquer all. Only[LINE]
the mightiest of men can wield them.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B0E90
#WRITE(ptr,$18EFF0)
撥弦楽器のひとつ。[LINE]
鼈甲やセルロイド製の爪で弾いて[LINE]
演奏する。[END]
English:
//Text $1B0E90
#WRITE(ptr,$18EFF0)
An offshoot of the lute. Its stings[LINE]
are plucked with a pick made of a[LINE]
tortoiseshell.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B0E30
#WRITE(ptr,$18F02C)
口琴の一種。[LINE]
アクアヴェイルで流行した楽器。[LINE]
針のような鉄を指で弾いて鳴らす。[END]
English:
//Text $1B0E30
#WRITE(ptr,$18F02C)
An instrument popularized in Aquaveil. It[LINE]
is usually plucked with a bachi instead of[LINE]
fingers and is often used when storytelling.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B0DE0
#WRITE(ptr,$18F068)
撥弦楽器のひとつ。[LINE]
二本一組みに張られた[LINE]
多数の弦をもつ。[END]
English:
//Text $1B0DE0
#WRITE(ptr,$18F068)
The instrument of a Bard.[LINE]
It has many strings that[LINE]
are strung in pairs.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B0D80
#WRITE(ptr,$18F0A4)
撥弦楽器のひとつ。[LINE]
左手の指で弦を押さえて音程を調え、[LINE]
爪やピックで弦を弾く。[END]
English:
//Text $1B0D80
#WRITE(ptr,$18F0A4)
The instruments of stars.[LINE]
You press down the strings[LINE]
and pluck them with a pick.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B0D28
#WRITE(ptr,$18F0E0)
撥弦楽器のひとつ。[LINE]
棹に貼った三弦を撥を用いて奏する。[LINE]
ぺんぺん。[END]
English:
//Text $1B0D28
#WRITE(ptr,$18F0E0)
A string instrument originally from Aquaveil.[LINE]
Its three strings are plucked with a plectrum.[LINE]
Peng! Peng![END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B0CB0
#WRITE(ptr,$18F11C)
無限を意味するギター。[LINE]
その音色は銀河の彼方まで届く。[LINE]
選ばれた者のみが手にできる。[END]
English:
//Text $1B0CB0
#WRITE(ptr,$18F11C)
A guitar of infinite potential. Its tone[LINE]
reaches the depths of space. It can[LINE]
only be wielded by the chosen one.[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B0C50
#WRITE(ptr,$18F158)
実に含まれる糖分が多い[LINE]
とうもろこし。[LINE]
新鮮なうちに食べるほど甘い。[END]
English:
//Text $1B0C50
#WRITE(ptr,$18F158)
Corn with high sugar content in the kernels.[LINE]
The fresher it is, the sweeter it is.[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B0BF8
#WRITE(ptr,$18F194)
どこの家庭にもある一般的なおたま。[LINE]
叩かれたらそれなりに痛いです。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B0BF8
#WRITE(ptr,$18F194)
A common ladle found in every home.[LINE]
A standard for corporal punishment.[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B0BA8
#WRITE(ptr,$18F1D0)
ちょっと高価な銅製のおたま。[LINE]
銅は熱伝導率が高いのですが……[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B0BA8
#WRITE(ptr,$18F1D0)
A rather expensive copper ladle. Wait,[LINE]
doesn't copper conduct a lot of heat?[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B0B60
#WRITE(ptr,$18F20C)
珍しい銀製のおたま。[LINE]
銀製品はこまめなお手入れが肝心！[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B0B60
#WRITE(ptr,$18F20C)
A rare Silver Ladle. Make sure to[LINE]
take care of your silverware![LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B0B10
#WRITE(ptr,$18F248)
金持ちの証し！金製のおたま。[LINE]
調理道具というより飾り用。[LINE]
[END]
English:
//Text $1B0B10
#WRITE(ptr,$18F248)
A ladle made of gold, to flex your[LINE]
Gald. Disclaimer: Not for cooking.[LINE]
[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B0A98
#WRITE(ptr,$18F284)
熱狂的な料理ファンのための[LINE]
究極のおたま。実際に[LINE]
料理が美味しくなるかどうかは不明。[END]
English:
//Text $1B0A98
#WRITE(ptr,$18F284)
An unrivaled ladle for cooking enthusiasts![LINE]
I'm not certain it will make your food taste[LINE]
any better...[END]

Japanese:
//Text $1B0A38
#WRITE(ptr,$18F2C0)
カロテンを豊富に含むにんじん。[LINE]
バターや油で調理すると[LINE]
吸収が促進される。[END]
English:
//Text $1B0A38
#WRITE(ptr,$18F2C0)
Carrots are rich in carotene.[LINE]
Absorbtion is improved if you[LINE]
cook it in butter or oil.[END]
